review: Setup was fairly simply, connect to the TV HDMI, plug in the USB (either plug into the TV USB or use the included power adapter to plug into a wall outlet).  Next use a phone or table to connect to the device (download the chromecast app) and set it up.  You then can cast certain things to your Chromecast.This worked slightly better for me than the Roku stick I previously purchased and returned.  It has a HDMI/WiFi extender cable included which helped with the upstairs TV but only marginally.  I found that with a newer wireless router this Chromecast (and perhaps the Roku stick) work much better and do no cause a complete shut down or lag of my wireless connection when using other devices.  I have this setup on the upstairs TV in a room that is furthest from my router.  Initially the signal was not strong enough so there would be buffering and even more so if I tried using other devices while it was "casting".  The new router has a stronger signal and I am not experiencing any issues now.Everything is controlled via phone/tablet and apps so it's not like a Roku where you have a remote and navigate about making selections.  I've so fared used to steam youtube, flixster and google play movies along with some videos from various sites.  Some sites will block the ability to "cast" as I found out.  Also the "mirror" is in beta - mirror just means you can cast what is on your phone or tablet to the TV screen.  The "Cast" seems to work fine for other apps and you can even queue Youtube videos.  While "casting" you can still use your device, I did notice that google movies will show you the movie playing on the "lock screen" of the device if locks after inactivity.  You can pause/play without unlocking the device when it's in this mode.They have a number of offers available that you can check once the device is setup.  It took a while before my $20 Play Store credit appeared, but it did eventually appear.  I also have received two free movies - Gravity and X-Men and I think there is a LOTR available now.I'm still new to streaming but having this is nice and I can steam movie and music using it plus it is portable so can move it easily.
